Dear List

Please forgive me for this vaguely=
 sword related post, and lend me your 
signatures. Also, please forgive my =
typos made in haste while trying save a 
truly historic dojo, they are bein=
g addressed.

It is time to fight the man again. Multi million dollar Kodan=
sha publishing 
company want to tear down Noma dojo (Tokyo) as it does not =
suit them to have

a historically important dojo on their grounds. Before t=
he war, Noma dojo 
was one of the four great dojo of the eastern capital. N=
ow it is the only 
remaining one. It was the site of the last kendo competi=
tion that was 
attended by the Emperor, and the dojo of the most famous sen=
sei of the 20th 
century Mochida Moriji sensei.

Please support our opposit=
ion to tearing down such a wonderful dojo and 
memorable experience for vis=
iting kendoka. Here is a link for our petition 
to save Noma dojo.

http://=
www.petitiononline.com/savenoma/petition.html

Best

Paul
